reviewText: I'm a huge modded SHIII and SHIV player so I initially scoffed at this one, given how arcady it is, but I caved and bought it because it has to do with subs and let's face it, there aren't many sub games around. Shockingly... I don't hate it. In fact, it's pretty damn entertaining for short stretches. It's not a sim by any means, but it doesn't really pretend to be either. It's a bit like Aces of the Deep, which, when it came out (10 billion years ago), felt like a Sim because of the immersion factor, but deep down had mechanics that were not far from Crash Dive's. I feel like the devs left out a lot of immersion to save on costs and also probably from Political Correctness concerns, but that's really not a huge deal in the end. If you want to play Aces it runs fine under dosbox if you find the right version, but this gives you fairly similar gameplay with passable graphics and a laser focus on quickly resolving encounters so you can go do something else without giving the whole thing too much thought. It's bite size, and it's good. Get it if you like WWII sub stuff.

reviewText: Mobile port, which will automatically deter some people, but this one is pretty well done.  Nice water effects and it is fun sinking ships with torpedos or the deck gun (although pretty simple), diving to deploy decoys, and making an escape.  You can't see underwater, it goes into the map view, but this view is nice since it has ship models moving around and looks good with various info.  Seems like it has good replayability and is a nice way to burn 20 or 30 minutes at a time. You can pick up patrols where you left off.  Worth it IMO.
voteText: 19 of 19 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
The water effects on this game are superb - especially for such an inexpensive game. For example, I was right next to a sinking an ocean liner (troop transport)  and the sub rolled in the waves, up and down, Plus, originally  I thought the water effects were'nt all that great but when I actually observed the water (Chesapeake Bay for me) I realized how realistic they were.

Also, this game is a good value for it's price - one of the reasons I surf Steam to find gems like this. So it's not super-strategic - it isn't meant to be. But it's a good way to kill time for an hour or less (or more) - when you don't want to get involved at the moment with a heavy strategic game. Plus it's easy to learn and hard to master, as the aphorism goes.

Clearly an under-appreciated gem in my opinion. (And FYI I play with a mouse on an i7 so results of course may vary).

reviewText: Nice Submarine Combat game with great action and machanics.Played 31 hours and reached 30/32 achievments with Knight cross 10 million tons destroyed my latest achievement.This game at best is a 40-100 hours playable before you would get bored from the same game play depending if you want to play on harder levels or challenge a friend. The last 2 achievements I have are 500 and 1 million km sailed .Im at 139 thousand.So at that rate I would have to play over 200 hours more just to grind out the last achievements just sailing around . Thats the only draw back I can say about the game as me being a gamer always trying to get 100%.This is reallly unreasonable to do or have to do. The game does allow 2 x or 4x or 8x or 16x the action speed up to quicken the game and I used this skill alot and got  pretty good at the speed up game play to finish battles off faster. Over all good game for price but the sailing around is going to be a real grind if your looking to complete this game 100% .

reviewText:
This gams is a lot of fun. It's not a hard-core sub sim like Silent Hunter but its not all arcade lite either. It has a sim" difficulty level that is pretty challenging. On its easiest level its a fun game to just kick back and enjoy sinking ships. On Sim difficulty sinking a heavily guarded target and evading the escorts gives a deep feeling of satisfaction.

Pros:
good graphics
wide range of difficulty levels
real world sub tactics give best results (just like in a hard core sub sim)
price
random mission generator and campaign

Cons:
Bing a tablet/phone port the UI is not the best for a PC. Could use some hotkeys. Right now its all mouse
could use more camera views (torpedo cam
hoursPlayed: I can strongly recommend this game. Would love to see a Crash Dive 2 designed for PC from the ground up."

reviewText: Fun WW2 submarine arcade type game.  Very short learning curve.  It's a coast to play on easy but that's the level to practice your gunnery so you have a chance on the high level.  Once you have the basics down medium level can give you a good challange.  High level is just difficult enough to make me want to master it.  I also like the patrol stats as you fight your way through various convoys.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: A great little action simulation-lite game where you take on the Royal Navy as a German U-boat, using stealth (diving, time of day, positioning) and tactical combat (torpedo trajectories, evasion, decoys) to complete challenges, patrols and random encounters.\n\nWhile longer sessions highlight the lack of depth and fairly repetitive missions, Crash Dive is a nice little package perfect for brief bursts of gaming, with great graphics and great performance (even on low end machines).

reviewText: It is an arcadey submarine  game with hints of simmulation...well, a sprinkling. In light of so many games that take themselves so seriously, this one is a good balance to me. I find it a lot like Pringles...you know it's not real chips but dang it they're enjoyable...just one more! For price vs quality its a good deal, I reccomend this as a fun time killer, you will try again to see how much you can do in the limited fuel tim" you have. And watch that periscope...it'll get you in trouble!"

reviewText:
+ Easy to learn, difficult to master.
+ Good graphics.
+ Simple control scheme.

- No multiplayer.
- No islands or land barriers of any kind.
- Can only play as German Uboat.

If naval/submarine warfare interests you, but you're not ready to tackle the more hardcore simulators (such as Dangerous Waters), or you even if you just fancy something that's more pick-up-and-play, then this is probably the game for you.

reviewText:
The game is fun and quick to figure out.  The graphics aren't awesome but tolerable; while to controls are responsive and fun.  I wouldn't say it's a realistic simulator by any count, but sways more towards an arcade style.

If you were expecting to navigate a 3d environment from a 3rd person view like in steel tide, you will be disappointed.

All in all, the price is low, and It's a few hours of good fun.

6.5/10

Check out my Game-play video and Review on YouTube: https://youtu.be/G19xIVyqfKs

reviewText:
I would recommend this game if it had more depth to it. The game mechanics are great and this is probably the best mobile port yet! I have enjoyed this game a lot in the time I played it but without much of a progression or upgrade system I am not really interested. Surely a lot of people can get joy out of doing the same with varying difficulty but I require some depth to the gameplay. It brings back good Silent Hunter memories and makes me miss any progression even more.

To sum it up: It is a simplistic take on Silent Hunter which is suprisingly well made! Good job devs! You did a really good job developing and porting this game.

I am going to refund though because I just dont see any long term motivation in playing a pretty shallow but good game.
This is solely because of my personal preference so if you'd like to play a game that is easy to get and unwind on buy it!

reviewText: Graphics are reasonable but playability..... well I had dropped it after only an hour. So repetitive and frankkly boring. When hitting with shells from the deck gun these were completly innaccurate from placementr of shot, I might as well have been firing a deck mortar. Torpedoes ...... again these didnt really go where you pointed them and their efffect was to say the least innaccurate. If you are a sub sim enthusiast looking for realism, this defintely not your game. Cost me £5 to learn that it was a game that should have been priced at most at 99p, and that was entirely due to its graphics of sea and sky.\nSave yourself some money and dont go  for this game, its not worth the price.

reviewText: It's a pretty poor port of a touchscreen game to PC.  The menus look like they were crapped out of the 90's, and none of the game's tutorials or controls were revised to account for it being on a PC instead of a tablet.  The game itself runs okay, I guess.  But it's Unity, so that's hardly a difficult thing to achieve.\n\nAs PC games go, it just isn't fun.
